title: How to Build an Ultimate LEGO Pool

steps.headline: Gather Lego pieces you'll need:
steps.description: Long flat light gray pieces. Dark gray flat squares. Long narrow black rectangles.

steps.headline: Flip all of the pieces over.
Line up the narrow light gray piece and 2 dark squares to make one larger rectangle.
Place one black piece in the middle and the other two on either end.
Gather your materials:
steps.description: One dark gray flat Lego square. Tall red squares. Four pronged light gray rectangles. Two pronged blue slanted pieces. Two pronged blue pieces.

steps.headline: Stack one red piece on top of the other, and place on the dark gray square three rows down and two columns in
Place 1 two pronged blue piece on either side of the red pieces.
Put one gray rectangle on top of the blue pieces.
steps.description: (repeat steps 3 and 4 until all these pieces are gone)

steps.headline: Stack all slanted blue pieces on top of each other, on an angle.
Place slanted blue pieces on the tall red square
Gather the pieces for your pool.
steps.description: Large flat black rectangles. the rest of the light gray narrow rectangles. Eight pronged light gray rectangles. Flat blue squares. Black flat rectangles. Flat eight pronged light gray rectangles.

steps.headline: Make one large rectangle with the large flat black piece and smaller flat black rectangles.
Center the two blue squares on the new, larger black rectangle.
steps.description: (Warning: the blue squares may be difficult to push down, this helps simulate the waves and different height levels in the pool ;))

steps.headline: Place the smaller flat light gray rectangles on each long side of the blue squares.
Add the sixteen pronged narrow light gray rectangle on top of the other light gray rectangles.
Take the ten pronged piece and six pronged piece and place them on top of the flat light gray rectangles on the opposite side.
Put the eight pronged light gray rectangles along the edges, in between the longer light gray pieces.
Collect the Lego Pieces:
steps.description:
One light gray flat square. One flat white rectangle. Two flat light gray rectangles. 2 six pronged black rectangles,
2 four pronged black rectangles,
2 two pronged rectangles,
2 flat light gray rectangles, and 3 flat dark gray rectangles.

steps.headline: Take a light gray rectangle and place it onto the second row of dark gray rectangles.
steps.description: Alternate every other until the light gray and dark gray rectangles are gone. (creating stairs)

steps.headline: Center the long white flat rectangle on top of the dark gray rectangle.
Put these pieces on top of the light gray square.
Place each six pronged black piece on either side of the stairs.
Add the four pronged black pieces on top of the black six pronged pieces.
Place the two pronged pieces on top of the four pronged pieces.
Gather the base, slide, pool and diving board.
Line up the edge of the pool with the light gray side of the base.
steps.description: (Pool will hang off the other side a little.)

steps.headline: Place the diving board on the light gray side, with the white diving board over the pool.
Place your slide on the other side of the base.
Enjoy your new pool!

text:
Building the Base Gather Lego pieces you'll need: Long flat light gray pieces. Dark gray flat squares. Long narrow black rectangles. Flip all of the pieces over.  Line up the narrow light gray piece and 2 dark squares to make one larger rectangle.  Place one black piece in the middle and the other two on either end.  Building the Slide Gather your materials: One dark gray flat Lego square. Tall red squares. Four pronged light gray rectangles. Two pronged blue slanted pieces. Two pronged blue pieces. Stack one red piece on top of the other, and place on the dark gray square three rows down and two columns in  Place 1 two pronged blue piece on either side of the red pieces.  Put one gray rectangle on top of the blue pieces. (repeat steps 3 and 4 until all these pieces are gone) Stack all slanted blue pieces on top of each other, on an angle.  Place slanted blue pieces on the tall red square  Building the Pool Gather the pieces for your pool. Large flat black rectangles. the rest of the light gray narrow rectangles. Eight pronged light gray rectangles. Flat blue squares. Black flat rectangles. Flat eight pronged light gray rectangles. Make one large rectangle with the large flat black piece and smaller flat black rectangles.  Center the two blue squares on the new, larger black rectangle. (Warning: the blue squares may be difficult to push down, this helps simulate the waves and different height levels in the pool ;)) Place the smaller flat light gray rectangles on each long side of the blue squares.  Add the sixteen pronged narrow light gray rectangle on top of the other light gray rectangles.  Take the ten pronged piece and six pronged piece and place them on top of the flat light gray rectangles on the opposite side.  Put the eight pronged light gray rectangles along the edges, in between the longer light gray pieces.  Build the Diving Board Collect the Lego Pieces: One light gray flat square. One flat white rectangle. Two flat light gray rectangles. 2 six pronged black rectangles,
2 four pronged black rectangles,
2 two pronged rectangles,
2 flat light gray rectangles, and 3 flat dark gray rectangles. Take a light gray rectangle and place it onto the second row of dark gray rectangles. Alternate every other until the light gray and dark gray rectangles are gone. (creating stairs) Center the long white flat rectangle on top of the dark gray rectangle.  Put these pieces on top of the light gray square.  Place each six pronged black piece on either side of the stairs.  Add the four pronged black pieces on top of the black six pronged pieces.  Place the two pronged pieces on top of the four pronged pieces.  Putting it all together Gather the base, slide, pool and diving board.  Line up the edge of the pool with the light gray side of the base. (Pool will hang off the other side a little.) Place the diving board on the light gray side, with the white diving board over the pool.  Place your slide on the other side of the base.  Enjoy your new pool!
